name: Afghanistan
currentCrisisSummary:
Since the Taliban takeover in August 2021, Afghanistan endures widespread suffering driven by **economic collapse** and the **systematic dismantling of civil society**. This crisis is co-driven by two primary factors:

1.  **External economic warfare**: The freezing of $7 billion in central bank assets and broad **financial restrictions** imposed by Western powers, which function as **collective punishment** and cripple the state.

2.  **Internal Taliban repression**: The regime's implementation of **gender apartheid**, including the **systematic exclusion of women** from education and employment, which has shattered 50% of the workforce, collapsed household incomes, and fatally crippled humanitarian aid delivery.

These dynamics, layered upon the legacy of a 20-year, **aid-dependent rentier state**, have produced one of the world's worst humanitarian emergencies.

imperialRoot.imperialPower: Britain & Russian Empire (19th c. - 1919), USSR (1979-1989), Pakistan (1980s-present), US (2001-2021)
imperialRoot.legacy:
Afghanistan's fragility is embedded in a long history of **foreign intervention**. The 19th century **'Great Game'** reshaped politics. **Soviet intervention** (1979-1989) precipitated conflict. Simultaneously, **Pakistan's 'strategic depth' doctrine** fuelled the conflict, with its **intelligence services (ISI)** cultivating, funding, and providing sanctuary to the Taliban to serve its own regional interests.

The **US intervention** after 2001 created a hollow, **aid-dependent rentier state**. This project was fundamentally **neoliberal** and corrupt, prioritising **privatisation**, outsourcing to **foreign contractors**, and empowering a network of **warlords**, hollowing out the state from its inception.

historicalContext.title: Pakistan and 'Strategic Depth'
historicalContext.description: Afghanistan's instability is inseparable from **Pakistan's regional ambitions**. Seeking 'strategic depth' against India, Pakistan's **Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI)** has for decades pursued a policy of interference, most decisively through the creation, funding, sanctuary, and military support for the **Taliban insurgency**. This **state-sponsorship** was the primary enabler of the Taliban's 2021 victory.

historicalContext.title: The Warlord-Contractor State (2001-2021)
historicalContext.description: The 20-year **US-led occupation** was not a 'failed' state-building project but a *successful* one that built the intended state: a hollow shell. Power was **devolved to allied warlords** who were empowered with impunity. This created a **corrupt elite** loyal to **foreign contracts** and **aid flows**, not the population. The **Afghan National Army** was a paper tiger, dissolving in 2021 because it was built on this foundation of **systemic corruption**.

historicalContext.title: Taliban Governance and Gender Apartheid
historicalContext.description: The post-2021 crisis is also **internally driven**. The Taliban's implementation of a rigid, misogynistic ideology amounts to **gender apartheid**. The **banning of women from education and employment** (including for NGOs) has not only erased human rights but has **functionally collapsed the economy** and severely hampered the delivery of humanitarian aid, exacerbating the suffering caused by external sanctions.

historicalContext.title: Economic Pressure and Sanctions
historicalContext.description:
Post-August 2021 financial measuresâ€”notably **asset freezes** ($7B central bank reserves) and banking restrictionsâ€”constrained imports and public services. Multilateral and **unilateral sanctions** contributed to **economic contraction** and worsened living standards. These function as **economic coercion**, disproportionately punishing civilians.

These pressures compound **climate shocks** and displacement, producing a massive crisis.

historicalContext.title: International Law and Accountability
historicalContext.description: Despite extensive documentation of **war crimes** and **human rights violations** spanning decades of international military engagement, meaningful **accountability** remains elusive. **International legal mechanisms** have been inadequate in addressing the harms caused by **foreign military action**, **proxy warfare**, and **economic strangulation** that led to state collapse. Investigations by UN bodies and civil society have catalogued violations by all parties, but **impunity** prevails due to geopolitical considerations. The **Rome Statute** and **Geneva Conventions** have provided a legal framework for potential prosecutions, yet **great power interests** have prevented enforcement. **Transitional justice** processes have been limited, failing to provide redress for victims of both international and domestic actors.

humanitarianImpact.title: Casualties
humanitarianImpact.description: Tens of thousands killed directly by conflict since 2001; far more suffer **indirect deaths** from healthcare collapse and malnutrition resulting from war and **economic blockade**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 23.7 million people require aid due to compounded effects of war, **sanctions**, **internal misrule**, and **state collapse**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Food Insecurity
humanitarianImpact.description: Around 15.8 million face crisis-level food insecurity from **economic strangulation**, **aid dependency**, **climate shocks**, and **internal policy failures**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Displacement
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 6.3 million internally displaced by decades of **foreign intervention**, conflict, **economic pressures**, and **climate breakdown**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugees
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 8.2 million Afghans forced into refugee situations by instability generated by **external interference** and **internal repression**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Healthcare Collapse
humanitarianImpact.description: Health facilities non-functional due to funding cuts linked to **international financial restrictions** and the **Taliban's ban on female aid workers**, which has crippled service delivery.

humanitarianImpact.title: Deepening Poverty
humanitarianImpact.description: Extreme poverty surged post-2021 due to **sanctions**, the implosion of the **foreign-funded economy**, and the **Taliban's exclusion of women** from the workforce.

timeline.event: **The Great Game**: A century of imperial rivalry between the British and Russian empires reshapes Afghan frontiers and politics, with three Anglo-Afghan wars and repeated interventions that undermine indigenous political autonomy.
**Soviet Invasion and Occupation**: The USSR intervenes militarily to support the PDPA, triggering a decade of war that causes mass death, displacement and the destruction of infrastructure.

**US Covert Support for Mujahideen**: The CIA's Operation Cyclone funds and arms insurgent groups resisting Soviet forces; this proxy warfare has long-term consequences for militancy and state collapse.

**Pakistan's 'Strategic Depth' Policy**: Pakistan's **ISI (intelligence service)** begins to cultivate, train, and fund Afghan militant groups, including the precursors to the Taliban, to secure its regional interests against India and establish a compliant government in Kabul.
**Taliban First Rule**: The Taliban seize Kabul after civil war and impose a repressive regime that severely curtails rights, especially for women and girls.

**US Invasion & Occupation**: Following 9/11 the US and coalition forces overthrow the Taliban and initiate a two-decade intervention, empowering corrupt **warlords** and building a hollow **rentier state** wholly dependent on foreign aid.

**US Withdrawal & Taliban Return**: The chaotic US withdrawal in August 2021 precipitates the rapid collapse of the corrupt, US-backed government and the return of the **Pakistani-backed Taliban** to national power.

**Taliban Repression & Economic Warfare**: The Taliban imposes **gender apartheid**, banning women from education and work. Simultaneously, international **asset freezes** and **sanctions** function as economic warfare, triggering state collapse and a deepening humanitarian catastrophe.

**August 31 Earthquake**: A major 6.0 magnitude earthquake strikes eastern Afghanistan, killing over 2,200 people. The humanitarian response is severely hampered by the pre-existing collapse of the health system and logistical paralysis caused by international sanctions and the **Taliban's ban on female aid workers**.

donate.description: A British humanitarian and development organisation working with deprived and excluded communities across Afghanistan.
Responds to the earthquake emergency, providing affected communities with food, clean water, shelter, and medical supplies.
Focuses on providing education and protection for children, particularly girls, whose lives have been impacted by conflict and the economic crisis.

advocacy.title: Challenge Economic Sanctions
advocacy.description: Advocate for the unfreezing of sovereign assets to ensure civilians can access essential imports, salaries and public services, and push for humanitarian exemptions to sanctions that impede life-saving aid.

advocacy.title: Amplify Afghan Voices
advocacy.description: Support and amplify Afghan civil society, especially women's rights activists, journalists, and human rights defenders.

advocacy.title: Fund Local Organisations
advocacy.description: Support Afghan-led organisations delivering aid on the ground and demand funding channels that enable direct, accountable transfers to local partners.

advocacy.title: Uphold Refugee Rights
advocacy.description: Push for safe and legal routes for Afghan refugees and an end to deportations.

advocacy.title: Demand Accountability
advocacy.description: Demand transparency and accountability for the costs and consequences of decades of foreign interventions and profiteering.

reading.title: *Ghost Wars: The Secret History of the CIA, Afghanistan, and Bin Laden, from the Soviet Invasion to September 10, 2001*
reading.description: Steve Coll's investigative account of US covert operations and their longer-term effects in Afghanistan.

reading.title: *No Good Men Among the Living: America, the Taliban, and the War Through Afghan Eyes*
reading.description: Anand Gopal's reporting on ordinary Afghans' experiences of war, occupation and the post-2001 political order.

reading.title: *The Afghanistan Papers: A Secret History of the War*
reading.description: Craig Whitlock uses confidential documents to expose the systemic failures and deceptions of the 20-year US war effort.
